tit.cmt: 原文に「」がないので'を削除

sen.j: 辛子明太子（からしめんたいこ）とはスケトウダラの卵巣を唐辛子等を使った調味液で味付けしたもので、食材および食品の一種である。
sen.e: Karashi-mentaiko (spicy salted cod roe) is a foodstuff made of ovary from a kind of cod, Walleye pollack, processed with seasoning of red pepper sauce.
Karashi-mentaiko (spicy salted cod roe) is a foodstuff made from the ovaries of a kind of cod, Walleye pollack, processed by seasoning it with red pepper sauce.
Karashi-mentaiko (spicy salted cod roe) is foodstuff made from the ovaries of a kind of cod, Walleye pollack, processed by seasoning it with red pepper sauce.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 近年は明太子と略されることも多いが、正しい言い方ではない。
sen.e: It is abbreviated and called 'Mentaiko' recently, however, it is not correct expression.
It has been referred to as 'Mentaiko' recently, however, it is not the correct expression.
It has been referred to as Mentaiko recently, however, this expression is not correct.
sen.cmt: 原文に「」がないので'を削除

sen.j: 同じくスケトウダラの卵巣を材料とする食品にたらこがある。
sen.e: Similar food made of ovary from walleye pollack is cod roe.
Food similar to that made from the ovaries of the walleye pollack is cod roe.
Food made from the ovaries of the walleye pollack similar to karashi-mentaiko is cod roe.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 博多（福岡県福岡市）の名産品で、広く九州・山口県地方の土産物としても知られる。
sen.e: Karashi-mentaiko' is a specialty of Hakata (Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture) and also known as a souvenir of Kyushu region and Yamaguchi Prefecture.
Karashi-mentaiko' is a specialty of Hakata (Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture) and also known as a souvenir for the Kyushu region and Yamaguchi Prefecture.
Karashi-mentaiko is a specialty of Hakata (Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture) and also known as a souvenir from the Kyushu region and Yamaguchi Prefecture.

sen.j: しかし近年では一般化し、全国の食料品店でも容易に入手が可能である。
sen.e: However, it became common and easily available at food stores everywhere in the country.
However, it is now commonly found in food stores across the country.
However, it is now commonly found in food stores across the country.

sen.j: 語源は中国語にまでさかのぼることが可能であるが、直接には朝鮮語でスケトウダラのことを「ミョンテ」と言ったのが始まりである。
sen.e: It is possible to trace back the derivation of the name to Chinese language, however, more closely-related is that they call walleye pollack as "myonte" in Korean language.
It is possible to trace the derivation of the name to the Chinese language, however, more closely-related is that they call walleye pollack as "myonte" in Korean language.
It is possible to trace the derivation of the name to the Chinese language, however, its actual origins come from Korean, in which walleye pollack is known as 'myonte.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にit's→itsに変更しました。

sen.j: 朝鮮半島で作られたスケトウダラの塩漬けは、17世紀に北九州・山口地方へ伝わった。
sen.e: Salted walleye pollack was imported to northern Kyushu and Yamaguchi regions in the 17th century.
Salted walleye pollack was imported to northern Kyushu and Yamaguchi regions in the 17th century.
Salted walleye pollack was imported to northern Kyushu and Yamaguchi regions in the 17th century.

sen.j: このためこの地方では江戸時代から、スケトウダラを「めんたい」と呼んだ。
sen.e: As a result, walleye pollack have been called 'mentai' in these regions since the Edo period.
As a result, walleye pollack have been called 'mentai' in these regions since the Edo period.
As a result, walleye pollack have been called 'mentai' in these regions since the Edo period.

sen.j: 漢字表記「明太」は朝鮮半島でミョンテを「明太魚」、「明太」と書いたことからきている。
sen.e: The expression of 'mentai' in Chinese characters "明太" in Japan came from that they express 'myonte' as "明太魚" or "明太" in Korean peninsula.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記が名称の由来の説明に必要なので漢字を使用しています。他にも同例あり。
sen.e: The expression of 'mentai' in Chinese characters "明太" in Japan came from that they express 'myonte' as "明太魚" or "明太" in Korean peninsula.
The expression of 'mentai' in Chinese characters '明太' in Japan came from the fact that 'myonte' was written as '明太魚' or '明太' in the Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にpeninsula→Peninsulaに変更しました。

sen.j: つまり「明太」とは「タラ」のことであり、「明太子」とは「タラコ」という意味になる。
sen.e: Therefore in Japan, "明太" means cods and "明太子" means cod roe as "子" (ko) means a child or children.
Therefore in Japan, "明太" means cods and "明太子" means cod roe as "子" (ko) means a child or children.
Therefore in Japan, '明太' means cods and '明太子' means cod roe as '子' (ko) means a child or children.

sen.j: 朝鮮半島では辛子明太という食べ物があるが、これは唐辛子で味付けした「タラ」である。
sen.e: There is a food called "辛子明太" in Korean Peninsula, which is a cod processed with red peppers (generally, 辛子 means peppers.)
There is a food called "辛子明太" in Korean Peninsula, which is a cod processed with red peppers (generally, 辛子 means peppers.)
There is a food called '辛子明太' in the Korean Peninsula, which is 'cod' processed with red peppers (generally, '辛子' means peppers.)
sen.cmt: 漢字表記は上記にならって' 'とします。原文の「」に合わせ'を補足

sen.j: スケトウダラを加工して食べる食文化は、朝鮮半島で17世紀ごろには広まっていた。
sen.e: Cuisine culture to eat processed walleye pollack was already prevailed in Korean peninsula by the 17th century.
Processed walleye pollack was already prevalent in the food culture of the Korean peninsula by the 17th century.
Processed walleye pollack was already prevalent in the food culture of the Korean Peninsula by the 17th century.

sen.j: 日本に伝わったのは江戸時代である。
sen.e: The time when it was brought to Japan was Edo period.
And it was during the Edo period that it was brought to Japan.
And it was during the Edo period that it was brought to Japan.

sen.j: 日露戦争直後から太平洋戦争中にかけて、鉄道省（後の日本国有鉄道→現・JRグループ）は下関市と当時日本領であった朝鮮（現・大韓民国）の釜山広域市との間に関釜連絡船を運航していた。
sen.e: Just after the Russo-Japanese War to the middle of the Pacific War, the Ministry of Railways (later day's Japan National Railways and today's JR group) was operating Shimonoseki-Busan ferry between Shimonoseki City and then-Japanese territory Busan City (today's Busan Metropolitan City) in Korea (today's Republic of Korea.)

Just after the Russo-Japanese War to the middle of the Pacific War, the Ministry of Railways (later day's Japan National Railways and today's JR group) was operating the Shimonoseki-Busan ferry between Shimonoseki City and then-Japanese territory Busan City (today's Busan Metropolitan City) in Korea (today's Republic of Korea.)

Just after the Russo-Japanese War to the middle of the Pacific War, the Ministry of Railways (later known as Japan National Railways and today's JR group) was operating the Shimonoseki-Busan ferry between Shimonoseki City and then-Japanese territory Busan City (today's Busan Metropolitan City) in Korea (today's Republic of Korea).

sen.j: この連絡船を経由して、明太の卵巣の辛子漬け（「明卵漬（ミョンナッジョ）」）が下関へ輸入された。
sen.e: Fermented peppered ovary from 'mentai' namely walleye pollack called 'Myonnajjo' in Korean language was imported to Shimonoseki via the ferry.
sen.cmt: 明卵漬（ミョンナッジョ）はローマ字表記しています。
sen.e: Fermented peppered ovary from 'mentai' namely walleye pollack called 'Myonnajjo' in Korean language was imported to Shimonoseki via the ferry.
Fermented peppered ovary from 'mentai' namely walleye pollack called 'Myonnajjo' in Korean language was imported to Shimonoseki via the ferry.

sen.j: これは唐辛子やニンニクでまぶした「キムチ」に近いものであった。
sen.e: This was a food dredged with red pepper and garlic and something similar to 'kimchi' (rather than today's karashi-mentaiko.)
This was a food dredged with red pepper and garlic and something similar to 'kimchi' (rather than today's karashi-mentaiko.)
This was a food dredged with red pepper and garlic and something similar to 'kimuchi' (rather than today's karashi-mentaiko).
sen.cmt: ピリオドkimchi→kimuchiに変更しました。

sen.j: 1949年に唐辛子等を使った調味液に漬ける漬け込み製法の辛子明太子が博多で発売された。
sen.e: In 1949, 'karashi-mentaiko' of which process was to dip in red pepper sauce went on the market in Hakata.
In 1949, 'karashi-mentaiko' where the ovaries were dipped in red pepper sauce went on the market in Hakata.
In 1949, ovaries were dipped in a red pepper sauce and went on the market in Hakata under the name karashi-mentaiko,
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 当時は、当時の日本人には辛すぎた為、殆ど売れなかった。
sen.e: However, it did not sell much as it was too hot for the Japanese people at the time.
However, it did not sell well as it was too hot for the Japanese people at the time.
However, it did not sell well as it was too piquant for the Japanese people at the time.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後、1959年に改良された辛子明太子が発売され、レシピの無料配布等で博多中に広まった。
sen.e: Later in 1959, improved 'karashi-mentaiko' went on the market, and its recipe was given out free of charge and was spread in Hakata.
Later in 1959, an improved 'karashi-mentaiko' went on the market, and its recipe was given out free of charge and was spread in Hakata.
Later in 1959, an improved karashi-mentaiko went on the market, and its recipe was distributed free of charge and was prevailed in Hakata.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: さらに下関では1960年頃には日持ちをよくするために唐辛子をまぶす再加工をしたまぶし製法の辛子明太子が発売された。
sen.e: Further, 'karashi-mentaiko' made with a new method to preserve the product longer by reprocessing 'karashi-mentaiko' to dredging it with red pepper was sold in Shimonoseki in around 1960.
Further, 'karashi-mentaiko' was made with a new method to preserve the product longer by reprocessing 'karashi-mentaiko' and dredging it with red pepper, which was sold in Shimonoseki around 1960.
Further, karashi-mentaiko was made in a new method to preserve the product longer by reprocessing karashi-mentaiko and dredging it with red pepper, which was sold in Shimonoseki around 1960.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1975年に山陽新幹線が博多駅まで開業した際、博多名産・辛子明太子のほうが広く世間に広まった影響から急速に全国へ波及した。
sen.e: In 1975 when Sanyo Shinkansen bullet train line reached Hakata, Hakata specialty 'karashi- mentaiko' firstly spread in the whole country rapidly.
In 1975 when the Sanyo Shinkansen bullet train line reached Hakata, the Hakata specialty 'karashi- mentaiko' first spread around the whole country rapidly.
In 1975 when the Sanyo Shinkansen bullet train line reached Hakata, the Hakata specialty karashi-mentaiko spread rapidly throughout the whole country before karashi-mentaiko in Shimonoseki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: このために下関のまぶし製法よりも博多で盛んであった漬け込み製法が主流となった。
sen.e: As Hakata product went on the market first, dipping process type developed in Hakata became more popular than reprocessed type developed in Shimonoseki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As the Hakata product went on the market first, the dipping process type developed in Hakata became more popular than the reprocessed type developed in Shimonoseki.
As the Hakata product went on the market first, the dipping process product developed in Hakata became more popular than the reprocessed type developed in Shimonoseki.

sen.j: 現在でも量販向けで広く流通している。
sen.e: Hakata type is adopted as the way to manufacture for mass market today.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Hakata type was adopted and is still used for mass production today.
The Hakata type was adopted and is still used for mass production today.

sen.j: また、まぶし製法も少数ながら生産されており市場向けの高級品として流通し住み分けがなされている（下関では前田によりまぶし製法のみを行っているイメージがあるが、古来より両製法とも行われている）。
sen.e: However, even for a smaller market, the reprocessed type products are also being manufactured and distributed today as a high-grade article and these two types are successfully segregated (there is an impression that only the reprocessed method have been adopted by manufacturers of Shimonoseki such as Maeda, etc., both types of methods have been adopted in Shimonoseki from the past.)

However, for smaller markets, the reprocessed type products are also being manufactured and distributed today as a high-grade article and these two types are successfully segregated (there is an impression that only the reprocessed method have been adopted by manufacturers of Shimonoseki such as Maeda, etc., both types of methods have been adopted in Shimonoseki from the past.)

However, for a smaller market, the reprocessed type products are also being manufactured and distributed today as a high-grade article and these two types are successfully segregated (there is an impression that only the reprocessed method have been adopted by manufacturers of Shimonoseki such as Maeda and so on, but both methods have been adopted in Shimonoseki from the past).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1980年代には土産物の販売ルート以外にも、百貨店・量販店で広く販売されるようになり、全国でおにぎり・パスタの具として広く利用・販売されている。
sen.e: In the '80s, it began to sell in department stores and mass sales stores other than the sales channel for souvenirs, and today it is used as an ingredient of rice ball and pasta country-wide.
In the '80s, it began to sell in department stores and retail stores other than souvenir shops, and today it is used as an ingredient for rice balls and pasta country-wide.
In the '80s, it began to sell in department stores and retail stores other than souvenir shops, and today it is used as an ingredient for rice balls and pasta country-wide.

sen.j: 2007年には、おにぎりなどの加工用辛子明太子の出荷量が、ついに土産用の辛子明太子の出荷量を逆転した。
sen.e: In 2007, sales volume of 'krashi-mentaiko' for processing use exceeded that for souvenir use.
In 2007, the sales volume of 'krashi-mentaiko' for processing use exceeded that of souvenir use.
In 2007, the sales volume of karashi-mentaiko for processing use exceeded that of souvenir use.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 卵巣の形を保ったままの高価なものは贈答や接待に用いられ比較的安価な形の崩れたものは家庭用として好まれるが、品質には特に違いはない。
sen.e: Although expensive products that preserve the shape of ovary are mainly sold as gifts or used at receptions, and lower priced products with lost shape are sold for domestic consumption, there is no difference in quality between them.

Although expensive products that preserve the shape of the ovary are mainly sold as gifts or used at receptions, and lower priced products without this shape are sold for domestic consumption, there is no difference in quality.

Although expensive products that retain the original shape of the ovary are mainly sold as gifts or used at receptions, and lower priced products that do not retain the original shape are sold for domestic consumption, there is no difference in quality.

sen.j: 皮が切れたものを「きれこ」と称し、安く販売している。
sen.e: Karashi mentaiko' with broken membrane is called 'kireko' (literally, broken thing) and is sold at less expensive price.
Karashi mentaiko' with broken membrane is called 'kireko' (literally, broken thing) and is sold at a lower price.

sen.j: 最近は、見た目に美しい見栄えのする「着色タイプ」と健康志向に対応した「無着色タイプ」が選べる店が多くなっている。
sen.e: These days, shoppers are able to choose the merchandises from more attractive "tinted products" and "color free" health-oriented products" at many stores.
These days, shoppers are able to choose the merchandises from more attractive "tinted products" and "color free" health-oriented products" at many stores.
These days, options of more attractive 'tinted products' and 'color free' health-oriented products become available at more and more stores.

sen.j: 副菜としてそのまま、もしくは好みにより軽く焼いて食卓に供する。
sen.e: Serve it as it is as a side dish, or cook it slightly according to taste.
Serve it as it is as a side dish, or cook it slightly according to taste.
Serve it as it is as a side dish, or cook it slightly depending on each one's preference.

sen.j: また酒肴やおにぎり、茶漬けの具材としても好まれる。
sen.e: It is also favored as a relish taken with sake, or ingredient of 'chazuke' (boiled rice with tea poured over it.)
It is also favored as a relish taken with sake, or ingredient for 'chazuke' (boiled rice with tea poured over it.)

sen.j: マヨネーズと和えて「めんたいマヨネーズ」としたり生クリームやチーズと和える場合もある。
sen.e: It is sometimes dressed with mayonnaise (mentai-mayonnaise), dairy cream and cheese.

sen.j: マヨネーズを加えたソース (調味料)をパスタの上にかけて「たらこスパゲティ」（明太スパゲティとも）とすることもある。
sen.e: Pasta with sauce that uses the 'mentai-mayonnaise' is sometimes served with the name "tarako spaghetti" or "mentai spaghetti."

sen.e: Some people fond of 'chazuke' with 'karashi-mentaiko' and 'Narazuke' (pickles seasoned in sake lees) saying that they are the best combination for green tea 'chazuke.'

sen.j: ペースト状にしたものをパンなどに塗って食べる事もある。
sen.e: Some people make spread made of 'karashi-mentaiko' flakes and apply to bread.
Some people make a spread made from 'karashi-mentaiko' flakes and apply it bread.

tit.cmt: 原文に「」がないので'を削除

sen.j: 「明太子」という言葉は全国的に見れば辛子明太子のことを指す言葉として使われる場合が多いが福岡県をはじめとした西日本の一部地域では唐辛子を使わない、いわゆる「たらこ」を示す言葉として辛子明太子とは明確に使い分けられるため注意が必要である。
sen.e: Mentaiko' generally means 'Karashi-mentaiko,' however, in some regions in the west Japan such as Fukuoka Prefecture, 'mentaiko' indicates pepper-less cod roe or 'tarako' thus it should be careful to call them as people there use the names distinctively.

Mentaiko' generally means 'Karashi-mentaiko,' however, in some regions in the west Japan such as Fukuoka Prefecture, 'mentaiko' indicates pepper-less cod roe or 'tarako' thus caution should be exercised when using these names as people in different regions refer to them differently.

Mentaiko' generally means Karashi-mentaiko, however, in some regions in western Japan such as Fukuoka Prefecture, 'mentaiko' indicates pepper-less cod roe or 'tarako' thus caution should be exercised when using these names as people in different regions refer to them differently.
sen.cmt: 原文に「」がないので'を削除

sen.j: 前述の通り明太子とは「スケトウダラの子」という意味であり「たらこ」を示す言葉として使う方が本来正しい。
sen.e: As aforementioned, 'mentaiko' originally means "children of walleye pollack" and this indicates "cod roe" by right,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As aforementioned, 'mentaiko' originally means "children of walleye pollack" and this indicates "cod roe."
As aforementioned, mentaiko originally means 'children of walleye pollack' and this indicates 'cod roe.'
sen.cmt: 原文に「」がないので'を削除原文の「」に合わせ"を'に

sen.j: しかし、元々たらこを示す言葉としての「明太子」が使われない地域にお土産としてメジャーになった「辛子明太子」がもたらされるうちにその「辛子明太子」の略称としての「明太子」が全国的に広がっていった物と考えられる。
sen.e: However, it is thought that when 'karashi-mentaiko' was brought as souvenir to the regions where there was not a word 'mentaiko' for cod roe, abbreviated word 'mentaiko' of 'karashi-mentaiko' spread the whole country.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it is thought that when 'karashi-mentaiko' was brought as souvenirs to the regions where there was no word such as 'mentaiko' for cod roe, an abbreviated word form of 'karashi-mentaiko' or 'mentaiko' spread throughout the country.

However, it is thought that when 'karashi-mentaiko' was brought as souvenirs to the regions where there was no word such as 'mentaiko' for cod roe, an abbreviated word form of 'karashi-mentaiko' or 'mentaiko' spread throughout the country.

sen.j: 料理名等に使われる時には上記の「明太スパゲティー」の様にさらに略した「明太」（めんたい）が「辛子明太子」を示す言葉として使われることもしばしば見受けられる。
sen.e: When it is used as a name of a dish, further abbreviated 'mentai' that indicates 'karashi-mentaiko' is often used as shown in the case such as 'mentai spaghetti' above.
When it is used as the name of a dish, a further abbreviation in the form of 'mentai' indicates 'karashi-mentaiko' is often used as shown above in the case of 'mentai spaghetti.'
When it is used as the name of a dish, a further abbreviation in the form of 'mentai' indicating 'karashi-mentaiko' is often used as shown above in the case of 'mentai spaghetti.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
